Reviews.Title: “Treviso: Trains, planes and automobiles and a vaparetto”
Reviews.Author: Ian_and_Sian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca Formenta in July for our sixth wedding anniversary. Great location, right on the lagoon and away from the bustle of the tourist area, but only ten minutes walk from Piazza San Marco. The hotel location borders a residential area giving it a local feel, in a street with nice restaurants which were mostly frequented by the locals. We booked a junior suite with lagoon view, which was well worth it. The room was very nice. Reasonably sized, clean and well appointed. The bathroom was big enough for two with a good shower. Breakfast was served between 7 and 10. Great if you needed a lie in after all the walking. There are a couple of tables outside where you can watch the boats and the rest of the World go by. Good selection of fruit and nice coffee. The staff were helpful and friendly and spoke several languages as do most of the restaurant and bar staff in Venice. We flew to Treviso and took a bus to the train station and then caught a Vaparetto to the Hotel. This added over 2 hours to the journey. Would use Marco Polo next time. Venice is a breath taking city and we loved it. Ca formenta is in a great location to explore with good access to the centre and to the other islands. Murano is well worth a visit. Had a fantastic time and would definately recommed Ca Formenta.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: nicolasa222
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our 1st anniversary and it was so romantic. The staff gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne which was very thoughtful. The staff were very friendly and helpful when we asked for directions. Very close to St. Marks and to Arsenale boat station. We will definitely stay there again if we make our way back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Still as good our second time round!”
Reviews.Author: filthiestfish
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here in july 2005 and loved it so much we just had to stay here again but this time we chose a Triple room with a lagoon view! We booked directly via the hotel's website, paying 188 Euros per night, for 3 nights. Once again it did not dissappoint. The reception staff are amazing from top to bottom. The German girl is just lovely :) The room is of a good size, always clean and with the magnificent lagoon view. The bathroom was on the small side and did not have a bath, although the shower was excellent. Breakfast is still as good as it used to be with lots of cereals and pastries to choose from, delicious ham and cheese, hot coffee, and fruit juices. It really did set us up for the day. On one of the days we took a free trip by water taxi , to the island of Murano, courtesy of the hotel. It's worth it, even if only to admire the beautiful glass collection. Beware though, they take you inside a factory, show you around, then pester you to buy something. We had to sneak out the back door to avoid being hijacked inside the place. Nothing wrong with a free taxi ride though! Hotel Ca Formenta is still as good as it's ever been and I highly recommend it if you are staying in Venice. I will most definetly be staying here on my return!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: voyageur007
Reviews.Content: + POINTS * Superb location * Just 2-3 mins walk from nearest boat jetty and only walkable distance to St.Mark's square... * Nice restaurants nearby ..budget eataways as well as first class restaurants * Suitable for those who prefer to b close to the main attraction in th city and also away from noise * Private boat jetty for taxis * Cosy and decorated nicely * Nice staff * Great and healthy continental breakfast * Room was new and pristine and we had a nice view from window looking over the Canal and San Maggiore - POINTS Far from the main railway station ..it will take 30 or 40 mins depending upon the boat u take Small room and bathroom ... We had to pay extra for getting a room with a nice view of canal. otherwise u may end up having room without a view

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: snoopstergurl
Reviews.Content: the only problem i had with this hotel is that i didn't get to stay longer at it.after a long day of travelling and worried what this hotel would be like after staying at other hotels in italy, this was like our oasis in the desert.we walked into airconditioned rooms. someone grabbed our bags right away and helped us to our room. it was a pretty fair size same with the bathroom,we have a tub and shower, and we stayed right off the kitchen and i didnt notice a lot of noise.the room was really clean, marble floors,very comfortable. the breakfast was great! yogurt,cereal,fruit. it was perfect and the staff was helpful. location was great because it was really close to the square but not directly in the midst of the tour boats.would definatly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: JBav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a couple of our friends in June. We found it to be in a lovely position for visiting the sights of Venice. The staff were friendly and helpful. the rooms were recently refurbished and it has its own jetty so you can arrive by water taxi straight to the door!. Very dashing! This is a simple hotet. but has everything one could want; the breakfast was excellent (apart from the coffee!) with fruit, cereals, yoghurts, ham, cheese....the lot really. It is 10 minutes walk from St Marks Square and close to a vaporetto stop, so all of Venice is within easy reach. There are tables outside where you can sit in the evening and watch the cruise liners drift past whilst enjoying a LARGE gin and tonic It really is lovely and I would go again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Area of Venice”
Reviews.Author: NWJeff
Reviews.Content: This was my girlfriend and my first visit to Venice - we decided on Hotel Ca' Formenta after reading some nice reviews on TripAdvisor. While the (expectedly small) accomodations were very nice and clean, the hotel's location is the main draw. This hotel sits at the (quiet) end of Venice nearest the residential section, but within easy walking distance of St. Mark's Square. The staff was excellent (though our boyish concierge could have been a tad less snooty). Breakfast is served in the lobby every morning consisting of muffins, yogurt, cereal, coffee or cappucino, etc... You can take this in the lobby or outside sitting at an umbrella-shaded table on the edge of the beautiful wide street (no cars anywhere on the islands!). Hotel summary: quiet, clean, recently refurbished, great location, fair price. Beautiful, beautiful city - lots to look at, such atmosphere! Wander around - we never once felt unsafe (even wandering around at 1a) and there's just so much to see! While *you* may find good restaurants somewhere, our experience with the well-reviewed restaurants we hit was that food was awful across the board - do not get suckered in, you will likely be disappointed. While Florence restaurants were *great*, and Rome's were at the very least good, Venice was dispiritingly bad. My recommendation would be to keep expectations for food low and stick with pizza, panini, beer, wine and gelato - laugh, drink, wander about. Save the food money for Florence or Rome. Getting around Venice - do not listen to anyone who tells you that you'll be looked down on for wearing tennis/walking shoes - nearly everyone during the day time is an obvious tourist wearing tennis shoes - and you will 100% need *very* comfortable shoes as you unavoidably climb and descend close to 1,000 steps a day. We listened to the 'don't bring tennis shoes' and ended up overpaying for a pair (75 Euro for walking shoes) to save my girlfriend's rapidly blistering feet (after only a day and a half) Here's a tip if you are flying in to Marco Polo and going directly to Venice - pay the extra and take one of the water taxis directly to the hotel. It'll save lots of time, lots of effort lugging your bags up and down the everpresent steps (don't underestimate this), and it affords a staggering and beautiful view of the city - who needs a gondola ride after this (at the same price, no less)? Top it all off? Ca' Formenta has a tiny dock so the water taxi delivers you right to the proverbial doorstep and the hotel staff handles the baggage transfer to your room. When we went it was around 90 Euros for the ride, and I still consider it money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotelbut...”
Reviews.Author: kimmbbers2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, conveniently located, just two bridges away from the Arsenal stop. Sort of away from the beaten track, more residential but an easy walk to San Marco and a water bus away from everything. The single room was pretty small but most hotel rooms in Europe are(the bathroom was tiny, could wash hands while...you know!) After I had read a review on Tripadvisor about taking a bath after a long day of walking in Venice, this was the hotel for me. EXCEPT there was no bath tub and I could not even switch to a room with one becuase they didn't have that many rooms with a bath. So if you are a double and might get a larger room or don't care about a bathtub, it is not a bad place to stay. Room was clean, convenient and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Whats the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: Harry31
Reviews.Content: The young lady and I recently stayed a long weekend in this hotel. I had noted all of the reveiws and thought we had found a little gem at a good price...Don't get me wrong, this a nice hotel, but i didn't think the reviews were totally correct. Ok, where to start...The staff were very friendly, the beds were extremely comfortable, and the location was good, and thats what you would expect in a 3 star at this price in venice. The breakfast was satisfactory, if not very basic, and the noise coming from plumbing in other rooms gave you a feeling of living in a pond, so best to be in the top floor causing the noise. Apart from that it was OK. and would probably stay again..Oh, a quick tip, catching a Alilaguna water bus from the airport?...don't buy tickets in the airport, you can buy them on the boat and save yourself 20mins queuing time!. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Long Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Holly2224333
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 stayed in this hotel weekend of the 23rd of March 2007 for 2 nights. The hotel is clean, good value and well located (easy walk to St Marks Square and next to Arinsal Waterbus stop), has its own jetty (if you book a watertaxi). The staff arranged for us to visit the glass factory (free watertaxi to the island from the hotel) which we really enjoyed, also Opera tickets were on sale at the hotel, and the staff recommended places to eat with maps. Brilliant long weekend- definately will return again. Holly

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolandamien
Reviews.Content: Great place to explore Venice from. Excellent location with great scenery just outside hotel, easy accessible to the Vaperetto and 5 mins walk to St Mark's square, what more do you want? Extremely helpful staff who left a bottle of wine in hotel to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday without even a prompt. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “anniversary delight”
Reviews.Author: smudgerWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: As I was looking to book something for a special occasion- our 25th wedding anniversary - & as we hadn't been to Venice before I spent quite a lot of time looking at website reviews finally choosing the Ca'Formenta. I got prices off a few of the travel sites but ended up emailing & booking direct with the hotel for the best deal, all communication with the hotel was prompt & consice. We arrived late afternoon at the airport & caught the public water taxi which was an unusual & great way to start the vacation, it dropped us off just a few minutes walk from the hotel. We purchased a 4day travel pass for the water taxi which we found a great way to travel, although sometimes pretty crammed in, they were much better than the usual humdrum taxis, buses, tubes etc in most big cities; we hopped on off at diferrent places throughout Venice stopping in between for leisurely walks, drinks & snacks as we explored the superb sites. We were not dissapointed with the hotel, it was pretty much as outlined in many of the reviews, a small friendly place in a great venetian location right next to the lagoon & a nice 10 minute stroll from the hustle & bustle nearer the city centre. We also enjoyed walking the opposite way to the centre exploring the venetian areas & having a drink or ice cream with the friendly locals. We mainly ate our evening meals in the restuarants close to the hotel which were all reasonable & friendly. After a meal on our anniversary night we sat outside & watched England play in a football world cup match (who said romance was dead !?); we sat with many nationalities & other hotel guests & had a great evening followed by a few headaches the next morning. The weather was sunny & warm during our stay & we ate breakfast each morning outside the hotel watching the world go by - fantastic. We never experienced any bad water smells that a few other travellors had mentioned but we did go in June & maybe things get a bit worse late summer after a few hot months ? We have visited many large cities throughout the world but we found the whole Venice experience magical, assisted by oneoffs like the water taxis & no traffic + the many interesting places to visit. Yes the centre was very busy at times, but generally we got round OK & loved the place as being totally different. Of course we had to do 'The Gondola' on our anniversary - expensive but it had to be done & we took some great memories back with us . We'll definately go again at some stage in the future (possibly 5+years as we do like to visit other places) & we'd certainly recommend the Ca'Formenta........it's not vast, it's not glitzy, but it's nice, it's friendly, it's a decent price & it's in a good location, nice & quite but only a short interesting walk from the centre. The hotel remembered from my booking that it was our anniversary & sent a complimentary bottle of champers to our room on the day which was a nice touch. All in all we had a great time, well recommened for a few days vacation. Hope this review helps others, if you go hope you have as nice a time as we did. Best wishes Keith & Pauline, West Midlands UK

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Traveller092
Reviews.Content: A small, well located, friendly hotel, well away from San Marco (500 metres), ideal for those who enjoy getting away from the beaten path. Great views over the lagoon, excellent friendly staff, would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Woerd
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We spent 4 nights at the Ca Formenta, and on arrival we were shown to our room (203) and given a complimentary bottle of prosseco. The room was more than adequate along with the breakfast. Plenty of choice - cereals, rolls, crispbreads, fresh fruit etc. Staff were really helpful and friendly and the location was excellent - near the vaporetta stop with easy access to the airport and surrounding islands (Murano etc). As for Venice itself both my husband and myself were a little disappoined with it on the whole. We were glad that we had picked the week after carnival to visit as it was quiet and queue free. The Peggy Guggenheim was a real treat - and we did go into the Basillica, but as the weather was so good we just meandered around. One definate eating place for the evening is the Casa Di Noble found not far from the Accedamia bridge - a real treat and not expensive - beware of drinking or eating near St Marks sq - as prices there are a complete rip off. We also went to one of the many Vivaldi concerts - it was OK but no where as good as a concert that you may see in London - although the ticket price was just as expensive and the concert only lasted 1 hour. Make sure you look inside the venue before purchasing your tickets, and make sure you know how many instrumentalists there will be, as the pamphlet often displays more than is actually playing on the night. Other than that enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0000
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. A little off the beaten tourist trail which was great. Easy walk from vaporetto stop. You are in a wonderful Italian neighborhood. Several great restaurants just down the street, easy walking distance. We had a very nice room with view of the water. Room was comfortable and very clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very cheerful breakfast area with excellent breakfast. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location by Jimmy and Heather UK.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyandHeather
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in January and it was just perfect. We arrived via Ryan air from Liverpool and got the airport bus into the Piazzale Roma (9 euro return) and as advised we bought 25 euro three day waterbus passes which you definitely need if only to get from Piazzale Roma to the Arsenale Waterbus stop and back again. You can take the number 42 or the number 1 but definitely go for the slower number 1 because your first hour in Venice will be a magical cruise right down the length of the Grand Canal past Rialto, Academia and of course St Marks and the Doges Palace. Get off at Arsenale and turn right and head in the same direction as the boat which has just dropped you off. You go over one bridge and the walk about 200 metres to another bridge which you cross and then the hotel is virtually the fist building on the via Garibaldi which is actually more of residential neighbourhood but it is only 10 minutes walk from St Marks. Everyone who arrives in Venice has to drag their cases so travel light and stay at the Ca Formenta because its easy to find (5 mins from Arsenale) and you wont have to spend half an hour dragging your case around the streets and over the bridges. You could of course opt for a water taxi but the 20 minute 2km ride from from Piazzale Roma to the front door will set you back about 50 euro and you don't want to get your pants pulled down in your first hour in Venice now do you!!! By the way don't even think about walking it unless you know your way around Venice and you have absolutely no luggage. The hotel staff were friendly and the breakfast was o.k. Our room was on the ground floor so it had no view but it did have a great bath and shower which was nice to relax in after a hectic day in Venice. It was warm and clean and most importantly for us, quiet. There are two restaurants close by. Both with similar menus and prices. The Giorgione food was good but you had to wait for an hour to get it and they don't seem too fond of tourists whereas the Garangala is much friendlier with much faster service. Venice is a beautiful one of a kind island city. It is very small and easy to get around both on foot and by waterbus but allow yourself plenty of time to get places. 2 kms on a waterbus can take along time even on one of the faster ones. Don't worry if you feel like you are bobbing up and down all the time even when your on dry land. Apparently everyone does. Venice is expensive but we paid Â£65 a night for the room in the centrally located Ca Formenta and only Â£25 quid each for the flights but its easy to blow a few hundred euro during a three day stay in Venice without doing any thing extravagant like a gondola ride or having a drink in St Marks. Best tip. Explore the city by canal at night. Its safe, well light and eerily quiet but all the more magical because of it.

Reviews.Title: “good value ca formenta”
Reviews.Author: malcs52
Reviews.Content: if you want to take no risk about staying in venice ,ca formenta is a good choice , goo d views , helpful staff , central location , it is value for money in an expensive place , you get what you pay for here , its not top of the tree but its clean , friendly and wort the money

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjohnson58
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this little hotel! We loved the location and our view was wonderful. It was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful! It was a good walk from St Mark's square but we never minded. Gosh, we were in Venice. Who minds walking?? We were four women travelling to Italy for the first time and found this hotel on the internet. It was perfect for us. We would stay here again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy for what it is but great view!”
Reviews.Author: Member777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in November. Location was good - a short walk to St Mark's Square along the lagoon edge, and 2 bridges away from the Arsenale waterbus stop. We had room 203 which had a fantastic view of the lagoon with a small balcony - this was worth the price (we paid about Â£100 a night). The bed was v hard and not comfy but the room was large and had a sofa as well. The bathroom had the essentials but was tiny. Breakfast was good - orange juice was overly sweet but the self service items were all replenished constantly and sufficient to see you through til lunch. We found most of the staff to be friendly but there was one guy on reception who just grunted at us when we checked in or tried to leave without leaving our key.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ideal and perfect home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Lyb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 days in early October and couldn't ask for better. The location is away from the hustle and bustle of the other areas that have most tourists. It was great to sit at the tables outside the hotel in late afternoon and see the locals coming home from work, meeting up at restaurants and the children playing in the streets. Upon my arrival, the hotel staff greeted my name before I even said who I was, and my luggage was brought to the room. I was pleasantly surprised to see a large fresh fruit basket, which came in very handy every night when I returned to the hotel after a busy day of sightseeing. The gentleman who brought up the luggage told me that they always do this type of thing for people who stay for longer period of times and/or are there for special affairs. I'm amazed at the people who say that the hotel staff is not friendly, from the description of the previous reviewer, the hotel staff is the same that I dealt with. They were always very pleasant and helpful, but then again, I'm not a very high maintenance guest and I don't expect to be catered to every minute of my stay. I did ask for a water taxi for my trip to the airport since I had to leave rather early in the morning. Even though I made that decision late in the evening, there was no problem with them calling and making the reservation. The water taxi was there on time in the morning and the hotel staff brought my luggage to the taxi without my having to request they do so. The room and bathroom were small, but very clean and perfectly cleaned every day. Since I don't have parties in my bathroom or hotel room, the size was perfect for me and there was plenty of room to walk around with my luggage in the room. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, hostile staff”
Reviews.Author: GoMimi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Ca Formenta for five nights in September. The location is good - it's out of the mayhem of San Marco and not far from a quiet stretch of park (good for running). The room was clean and we had a great view of the water, but everything else was terribly disappointing, especially considering we paid about $250 US a night. The double bed was really two single beds pushed together - there are almost no amenities, not even an alarm clock in the room. The staff - a rotation of three or four men - was entirely hostile down to the last guy. Every request - for directions, restaurant reservations, a power cord adaptor, a question as to whether any phone messages had been left - was met with indifference or a look and tone of voice as we (paying customers) had asked for something outrageous - as if we were staying at a camp site and were expecting breakfast in bed. Sometimes sarcastic, uncalled for questions were asked back by the staff. Maybe the problem is that all of Venice has become jaded by throngs of ignorant tourists, but that's not an excuse. We would not stay here again and I'm perplexed by the number of glowing reviews that precede this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: fruitcase
Reviews.Content: After the very positive reviews we were a little disappointed on arrival to find that our 'junior suite' was in fact just one smallish room. We were a party of two adults and two children so it felt a bit cramped till we got used to it -- just don't expect big rooms. Breakfast is fairly standard fare although the orange juice was spectacularly bad. You pay extra if you have cappuchino, otherwise you help yourself to coffee from a jug on a hotplate. Service is fine although sometimes a little offhand. Location is good. Far enough away from San Marco to be quiet and with more of a local feel, but just a few minutes from Arsenale vaporetto stop which connects you to everything you will want to see. We ate twice at Giorgione's in Via Garibaldi. First time was excellent (good prosciutto and seafood risotto) but the second time not so good at all. Worth trying but not always spot on. Eating out is generally expensive. Overall I'd give Ca Formenta an okay review -- but if your expectations are high you may be left a little underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Good but overhyped”
Reviews.Author: daviduk
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in a great position with wonderful views. The room was a reasonable size though not huge with good air conditioning with stunning views towards St Marks Sq and the lagoon. Having said that I personally think the reviews are somewhat overhyped which leads to a little bit of disappointment on arrival. As regards staff - most, though not all, were very helpful. The man who cleaned the rooms and looked after the baggage was extremely helpful. Two bits of advice: 1.deal with the hotel direct and specify that you want a good view. The room with the sun terrace sounds good. We had a junior suite which was really an average sized room with a settee in it. 2. restaurant: one of the reception staff recommended Da Franz which is a mainly fish restaurant not far away. The food is spectacularly good - cost approx 140 euros for 2 with wine. Check out the reviews elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: terrawee
Reviews.Content: We found the Ca Formenta hotel just perfect for our visit. We (3 ladies) thought that the room would be very small and cramped but it was perfect for us - and we had the use of a large balcony also which we didn't expect. So we were delighted with this hotel. The breakfast was very nice also with lots to eat - so we were very happy with it. Also it was away from the maddening crowds and very relaxing.In the morning when you came out of the hotel the beautiful water and boats and sunshine greeted you. Very relaxing stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous View”
Reviews.Author: daylon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 days in Venice and I had a fabulous holiday. Venice is a beautiful city and well worth seeing. I would recommend it to anybody but not for 5 days, as it is expensive. The Hotel Ca'Formenta was wonderful, our room was a good size with even our own roof-top terrace. Couldn't have asked for more! It was in a great location - just 10 minutes walk from St. Marks Square but yet facing the lagoon and near 2 vaparetto stops. I would recommend however getting the vaparetto (waterbus) to Giardini as opposed to Arsenale when you arrive as there is only one bridge to overcome with baggage if you go to Giardini. Get a 3 day pass for the vaparetto for â‚¬25 when you arrive at the airport as single journeys cost â‚¬5 and you will use it a lot, especially if the weather was hot hot hot like it was last week. I highly recommend the Hotel Ca'Formenta and would certainly stay there if I ever go back. Antoinette, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot To Stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldlyGirl
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review since our stay at Ca Formenta in February, 2006. I have enjoyed all the reviews on this hotel. This is one jewel of a place to stay. I can not think of any place I would have enjoyed more. The location was very easily located by vaporetto, off the beaten path, yet a ten or so minute walk to the heartbeat of Venice. Some rooms had beautiful views, including ours, except at the time we were there, they were doing some repairs and scaffolding blocked the view. No worries. We loved it anyway. The place is SPOTLESS. The front desk help was nothing short of fabulous. They went above and beyond in helping with helpful hints, restaurant recommendations and, more important to us, a bit of history of Venice. Breakfast, although it is called continental style, was just spot on. It is selve serve, but filling, tasty and a nice selection. Our room was small but just wonderful. Three of us traveled together and we never felt cramped. Bathroom was just brand shiny new. I can think of NOTHING negative to say about this place, and my only reluctance in posting a review of it is that it will become TOO popular and change! One suggestion on Venice. Bring your pocketbook if you like to shop because it is shopper's paradise. Small and elegant city, restful and relaxing without any hustle bustle, and delightful in every way. The highlight of our trip was a concert at a local small church of Vivaldi's Four Seasons. Paradise. I would stay nowhere else on my next trip. Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfh1963
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night stay at this hotel. Had booked it last minute and had managed to book two nights in a room overlooking the lagoon and two nights in a "standard" room. On arrival we were told that there had been a cancellation and could have the lagoon view room for an additional 20 euros per night. Glad we did! Room number 405 was ours and though it didnt have a balcony had great views all the same. Fortunate to have a bath and shower - the bedroom was on the small size but perfecty suited us and most importantly was clean and tidy - and each day was tidied up - just how it should be. We found all the staff friendly and helpful and breakfast was fine - if the weather is good try and sit outside you get a great view (apart from when the big boats are moored nearby! As to Venice - what a place! All in all a great experience - dont forget to buy your water taxi tickets - invaluable for getting around. And has anyone else experienced the feeling after their stay of still being on water? Been back a couple of days and get this strange feeling when sitting down of still being on a boat - weird!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NickyU
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it extremely comfortable. We had a 'suite' room with four beds and it was a good size, very clean and had excellent air conditioning. The room also had huge picture windows looking out over the bay where we could watch the huge private yachts go by. Breakfasts were usual hotel fare, but very good, and staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: anisha101
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website, my husband and I booked one night here in July. I emailed the hotel beforehand to get directions from the train station. We followed the directions and after 15 minutes we finally found the hotel. After finding the hotel we realized that there was a much easier way to get to the hotel. Just make a left after the stop and go straight!! We arrived at the hotel and were escorted to our room. It was pretty small but clean. The location of the hotel is great. It is about a 10 minute walk to St. Marks Square. The main problem we had with this hotel was the unfriendly staff. When we asked a question we were met with blank stares. They were not helpful or even that nice. So we ended up not asking too much! Although the location was nice I do think there are better options in Venice. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: winemama
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself wanted to go to Venice in June 2006 for my birthday. I spent hours and hours trawling through all the sites for a reasonable hotel in Venice that had water frontage. Eventually I happened upon the Ca' Formenta! The rooms looked good, the rate looked good and location looked fab. I booked the hotel for a long weekend and off we went! I also asked questions on Trip Advisor on how to get to the hotel from the airport etc and have to say that all the information I received was spot on! Every detail of the journey from Marco Polo airport to the hotel was exactly right. As we approached the Arnenale stop on the Alilaguna boat we could see the hotel and it also was exactly as seen on this site. On arrival our bags were taken to our room, and we were glad that we had paid a little extra for a view of the lagoon - it was stunning! At one point a huge cruise ship went by, only yards from our window - what a sight! Breakfast at the hotel is continental (only to be expected) and a quiet affair. Plenty to eat though and as soon as anything started to get low, it was topped up again. This hotel is on the Via Garibaldi which has loads of cafes and restaurants to eat in, and just far enough away from the crowds. In fact we commented on that saying that only five minutes away we were in amongst the hoards and only over one bridge and we were back in the quiet! Just a short way down the Via Garibaldo there is an unexpected park on the left hand side which we had a stroll in. It gave us some welcome shade as it was very hot while we were there. There was a pool around a statue which had not fish, but terrapins swimming and lazing in the sun! Altogether a perfect site for a Venetian break. We loved it and would most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: itwillwork
Reviews.Content: I was so reliant on Trip advisor in planning my first European vacation that I promised myself to return the favor with candid, detailed reviews and lots of pictures. Ca Formenta was our 2nd stop. Well what can I sayâ€¦? Glorious!!! Location, service, staff. First let me state my circumstances. This started out as a 70th birthday gift for my mum. The trip took a great deal of planning because mumâ€™s not as good with the walking as she used to be so we had a wheelchair along for comfort and safety; when mum gets tired pull out the wheelchair and keep on going. So all hotels had to either have a lift or accommodation on the ground floor and the room would have to have separate beds. We also needed a hotel that had its own wharf. Since we were traveling for weeks and many stops, we had lots of luggage. I had read other reviews where people talked about getting off at the closest waterbus stop and lugging their luggage over bridges to the hotel. Clearly this was not an option for us. I had to make this trip as pain free as possible so mum could relax and really enjoy herself. Boy, did I luck out with Ca Formenta. At the airport we hired a private water taxi that would take us straight to the hotel (should have reserved it on line ahead of time. Might have been cheaper. As it was, I paid about 120 euro which included the shuttle from the airport to the water taxi.) The ride, our first sight of Venice, was glorious. What a perfect place!! Anyway, the moment we arrived we were met at the dock by housekeeping who were ready to take care of our luggage (6 pieces plus a wheelchair) and were guided to the front desk where I was eagerly greeted by Simone Contin, a young gentleman who isnâ€™t the manager of the hotel but easily could and should be. Apparently he was the one answering my many e-mails, always providing specific answers to the tons of questions I asked. After a 2 minute check in we were escorted to our room, a â€œsuperior twin roomâ€� overlooking the Grand canal and local â€œstreetâ€� (weird to call it that when the only traffic is on foot.). En-suite bathroom, of course. The room was lovely. Everything seemed brand new. We had two windows, one huge one that could open fully to bring in the beautiful breeze, and a double glass door that opened up to a small balcony. Lovely. I stood on the balcony and took many a picture. You can see all the neighborhoodâ€™s activities from that balcony. And since itâ€™s not in the heart of stuff (literally a 10 minute walk to St.Marksâ€™ Square. 15 if you want to stroll which I strongly recommend!!!!!) you really get a sense of how everyday residents live. The hotel provides a continental breakfast in the morning with consists of breads, deli meats, cheese, cereal, fruits, tea, coffee, and juices. I would have preferred a full â€œhotâ€� breakfast but it didnâ€™t seem to matter much; our bellies were full and quite satisfied and we certainly did a lot of tasting at the various cafes and restaurants throughout the city. Anyway, Simone was instrumental in helping us plan our 3 days in Venice. The hotel provided free transportation to Murano (known thorough out the world for glass art) and a free tour of one of itsâ€™glass factories, and arranged tickets for us to see a jazz concert. Simone was also very helpful in directing me to the best place to find traditional Comedia Del Arte masks. The rest of our time was spent strolling San Marco, visiting the various museums and shops and, of course traveling the town on the Gondola. Taking the water buses from one place to the next was also a treat. Oh what an amazing place. Thank you, Simone and staff, for making our stay in your city such a magical one. I will definitely be back and will not stay anywhere else!!! A word of caution; travel light. Because mum and I had so much luggage (coming from the US into Europe we were well within the restrictions) we got hit with HUGE â€œexcess feesâ€� when traveling the intra-continental airlines servicing Europe alone. EasyJet, BMI baby, flybe, etc. charge between 5 and 8 euro for any kilo over 40 for each person. As insane as it sounds now, for each flight (and we went to Venice, Rome, Paris, and England) be paid around 400euro for excess weight!!!! â€œOuchâ€� is an understatement. EasyJet does not inform you of any weight restriction on their website and there is no number that you can call from the US. Whenever we got to the desk to check in, the airline representatives would look at us like we were insane. Oh well. Thank God for credit cards. Iâ€™ll pay it off one day. But mum had the time of her life. At the end of the day nothing else mattered.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: wannabe-in-Italy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ca'Formenta was a great place to stay in Venice. This was my first time in Venice and the location was great. It's 6 bridges from San Marco Piazza. We took a water taxi from the train station (a whopping 70 euros) but it takes you right to the hotel door (and we had 4 adults with lots of luggage). The people at the hotel were very helpful and extremely friendly. There were some decent, not so expensive restaurants right on the same road. The rooms were small in the european way, but comfortable. The shower is about the size of a shower on a cruise liner (don't drop anything!) but clean. There were some mold issues in our room (but it's Venice!). The breakfast was adequate and they even have a few tables outside. It was very quiet and we much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: workshy1234
Reviews.Content: We made a great choice with CA Formenta. It is away from the maddening crowd, room is comfortable, bathrooms are very clean and have the latest amenities, in-room safe and most importantly, airconditioning! The staff were very helpful and pleasant and have assisted us in many ways. Will definitely return and happy to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ekter
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here, in 2 seperate rooms, and couldn't praise this hotel more! The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms large and clean, and the location was superb. The skimpy breakfast was my only negative, but we ate so much elsewhere it really didn't matter. The hotel is not in the center of activity, but only a 10 minute walk from the hustle and bustle of st. marco and the realto area. I definately recommend walking 10 minutes AWAY from those areas, though. You'll find yourself in areas tourists rarely see, where the real venetians live and eat, and the scenery is every bit as romantic and exotic as the center of town. And for Venice, the hotel was even reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “worked for us”
Reviews.Author: Vanguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. The hotel was in a good location along the main canal. It was on a nice quiet street (with a park and few mini-marts that worked for cheap drinks...beware of ripoff restaurants)...about 10 minutes walk from St Marks square. The free Morano Island trip was a nice add on....we were advised by the hotel that the taxi would bring us back after an hour, or we could find our own way back....we actually took the waterbus directly to Lido Island and went to the beach after our tour. The rooms weren't too small (just average size) and overlooked a quiet canal, it worked for what we needed. They were relatively clean (with a small cigarette burn in our top sheet, but other than that OK) and the staff was very helpful with any questions we had. Breakfast was included and had a nice selection. I would recommend this hotel and may stay here again next time we travel to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A cool, comfortable respite from the Italian summer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing in Venice is new, but I was pleasantly surprised by this small, clean, and friendly hotel. After a stressful visit to Florence, it was so nice to encounter the warm and helpful staff of Ca Formenta. They were quick to recommend a restaurant, make our reservations, and help us with the complex transportation system of Venice. I could not have asked for a more pleasant atmosphere or a more hospitable staff. We truly felt like guests. The air conditioning was the best in Italy - we were actually freezing cold one night! Also, this was the only hotel we found in France or Italy with free internet access. I am a very discerning traveler, and this is THE hotel for anyone who is even vaguely concerned about price. I would absolutely return to Hotel Ca Formenta. I will preach the praises of this hotel to everyone I know traveling to Venice. Tip: If you arrive by train and have more than a carry-on size bag, just pay the money for the water taxi. Yes, itâ€™s 50 Euros from the train station, but itâ€™s worth it. They will drop you at the Ca Formentaâ€™s private dock. If you take the "water bus" to the hotel, you will encounter crowds and limited baggage area, plus 2-3 bridges from the "bus stop" to the hotel. Once you figure out the system, you can take the "water bus" back to the train station or the airport with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tsalib
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Ca Formenta for five nights in May. We had a party of six in three rooms. One room was a lagoon view and was bigger, but the bathroom smelled moldy all the time. The other two rooms were VERY small. You could barely turn around in them, and there was no place to put your luggage. The bathrooms were very small also. The location is quiet in an area away from the main tourist spots, but that also meant walking a lot. There were some good restaurants near the hotel, but some not so good ones, too. Get a recommendation from the desk. Also, a note about the free trip to Murano and the glass factory. The trip TO the island is free, but you have to find and pay for your own way back to Venice. Luckily, we had bought passes for the vaporetto, but we were not told this information until we were on the island. Breakfast had a nice selection of cereals, fruit, meat and yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: traveltales
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, about 10 mins walk from San Marco. We we're given the room mentioned on a previous review with the sofa bed (room 401) and asked to be moved. They moved us to room 104, a twin but with the beds side by side so it was as good as a double. The room and bathroom were on the small side but this place is excellant value for Venice and the rooms are pleasantly decorated, fresh and clean. The inclusive breakfast was a bonus, a really nice continental buffet and being able to have breakfast outside over looking the lagoon was a real treat. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. For a restaurant recommendation, we would say 'Naranzaria', a wine bar just beyond the Rialto bridge, near the fish and vegetable market - very reasonably priced drinks and a tapas type menu. One to avoid: We had a really bad meal at Osteria Al Schiavoni which is up an alley (Calle del Dose) off the lagoon near Arsenale - 107 Euros wasted on a really poor meal. (30 something couple)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Great location (about two bridges from all of the tourists), which after 2 1/2 weeks of travelling was great! Excellent view of the grand canal. About a 15 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, which was always crowded with tourists. Rooms were clean and small but nice. Our view was of another building, but apparently there are only two rooms with grand canal views and you have to book far in advance. Breakfast was good, similar to the other hotels we've stayed in. Concierge was very helpful. Note: Definitely purchase a 3 day water bus ticket, you will use it everyday unless of course they are on strike as they were for one day while we were there. If you come in by waterbus you get off at the Arsenale stop (about 45 minutes from the train station) and you have to walk over two bridges, which was challenging with luggage but we made it and would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bruinett
Reviews.Content: If your chief concern is not spending too much money on a luxury hotel, than this is a very good hotel. We found the staff to be very helpful and personable. The room is small, but clean, as is the bathroom. We had no complaints, but expect to get what you pay for. I would reccomend it if it is the price range that you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: winsumwzl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last summer--it was very nice, about 6 bridges from st mark's (10 minute walk). we were glad we didn't stay on the water closer to the main square (due to all the exhaust fumes there), or on the grand canal (kind of stinky in late august). it is very pleasant and quiet, the rooms were very nice. we are going back this summer and will stay there again, they have given us a 10% discount for the repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment in Venice, few problems though”
Reviews.Author: goodadvise
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment under the care of the Ca' Formenta in Venice, Italy. Meaning we wanted to stay in the hotel itself, but it was full. They have an apartment several doors away from the hotel on the same street that they can rent to a family when the hotel is full. We paid 200 Euros per night for this apartment. The first night we arrived we had a few problems such as no heat, but in the morning the hotel fixed the heating problem and adjusted our bill for the inconvenience. The other problem was the light in the kitchen. It never worked, but we were not there much for it to matter. The apartment has three large windows that opened onto a street and that was nice. The aparment was very nice as was the bathroom. We had breakfast at the actual hotel and that was nice. The staff was very pleasant. The location was good. A little farther than we expected from San Marco, but it was a nice walk on a street by the water lined with shops.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: AlexRobin
Reviews.Content: Venice is such a beautiful city but the hustle and bustle and the crowds can be overwhelming. Hotel Ca Formenta is located in the Castello area which is a 10 minute leisurely walk to San Marco which is the main tourist hub. The area has more of a local flair rather than a tourist trap from the shops, restaurants etc. At the end of the day after dealing with all the crowds and foot traffic , it is nice to retreat to a quiet and peaceful hotel where one can just relax and get some good sleep. This hotel is quiet and I mean quiet. We stayed at a room that is in the annex of the hotel and it was nice. For 120 Euro per night, I thought it was so worth it. The room and bathroom was clean, the staff was really helpful and friendly and the location is superb. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gilly_Tom
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a hotel! It's away from the main hustle and bustle of the tourist area, but only a pleasant 10 mins walk alongside the water from St Marks Square (we especially appreciated its location as we went during Carnival - great fun, but the city can be overwhelming at times with so many people in the streets!). The hotel is also ideally located for taking water bus from the airport - the Arsenale stop is less than 5 mins away - you can see the hotel on your right as you arrive. Rooms are on the small side but very tastefully furnished and spotlessly clean. We booked a superior room which had a day bed and possibly the smallest - but most perfectly formed - bathroom we have ever had in a hotel, with a fantastic shower. Hotel staff are really helpful and booked dinner for us one evening in local trattoria, which was very good. Breakfast is served downstairs and at weekends there were not enough tables at peak times, but staff were more than happy to find a tray and allow us to take our breakfast upstairs in our room, which is exactly what we wanted anyway! There was a good selection of cereal, fruit and pastries to chose from. All in all, highly recommended as a base for your weekend break in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..But,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved Ca'Formenta. Expecially it's location away from the congestion of the San Marco area and it's wide water view from the front. (And on a small side canal as well). Good local restauants. Easy access from the airport/vaparetto (this is especially hard to find in Venice). Very clean, nicely decorated rooms. Moderately priced. Updated bathrooms. Breakfast included. BUT, they didn't tell me they were refacing the building. Scafolding covered our two corner windows and workers would hang plastic over them while they worked. Tinkering would start about 9:30 and we were usually gone, but what a drag to find your windows covered on your vacation. Not all rooms are affected by this construction so if you're planning on staying, be sure to ask ahead of time. We got the most inexpensive room and our bed ended up being a pull out couch. But, not too worry. The mattress was not like the ones I think we all have in our homes. It was thick and comfy. But, if you're at all concerned - ask about that too. There are several room sizes and views to chose from in this little place. All in all - wow, I recommend. Just check to see if the construction will affect you. Remember, it's a little out of the San Marco area, (specifically in the Arsenale district)-no big deal. It can be easily walked and if you can find the Grand Canal you will always find your way home. Not like some of the hotels buried in the narrow, congested streets around the square. By the way, we are a "forty-something" married couple - as most were in the hotel. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: IR1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot in it's favour. It's very reasonably priced, service is friendly and efficient, it is only a 5-10 minute stroll from St Mark's Square and it seems to have beeen recently modernised. I would definitely consider staying here again when I am next in Venice. Importantly it doesn't try to market itself as something it isn't. It is a three star hotel that is clean and centrally located. I wasn't disappointed, and would agree with the other positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in late January at this little hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. I had booked via their website and had some difficulty with the computer which they negotiated with no problem. We were given excellent advice about local eating spots also. Clean room, great shower, great location (not in heavy tourist area but close enough to walk everywhere) - and for a great price in winter anyway!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: johnhprojwkr
Reviews.Content: We paid a little more for a lagoon view, and being able to wake up in the morning and look across the water was well worth the extra. The location is very good. It's on the water's edge on the southern side of the island, two or three minutes walk from a waterbus and 10 minutes from St Mark's Square - but just far enough out to be quiet and to feel "local". Our room was very immaculately clean, nicely decorated and well appointed (hairdryer, minibar, cableTV, etc etc). A minor niggle, as we were there six nights, some more drawer space would have been good. All the front desk staff are very helpful and friendly - answering questions and making suggestions. The continental breakfast was plentiful, fresh, and constantly refreshed. Coffee, croissant, bread cheese, meat, cereals etc. More than enough to keep you going till lunch. Some nights we ate at restaurants down Via Garibaldi. The third one along, next to the park - Il Nuovo Galeon - we enjoyed enough to go back. The fish was fresh and well cooked - and the staff were friendly and helpful (in English, too). Drink the house white, cheap and good. We weren't so impressed with either the price or quality of the place across the street nearest the hotel and wouldn't recommend it. It's always full, but it's hard to see why.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a delightful Venetian neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: milica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at this lovely hotel and we are grateful for discovering this place! The location of this hotel can't be beat for those looking for a peaceful & calm alternative to the loud & bustling area surrounding St. Mark's Square or the Rialto Bridge. One of the nicest things was approaching the Arsenale Vaporetti stop & noticing our hotel in the distance. After all of our extensive research it felt comfortable already. Prior to our arrival we sent numerous emails to the hotel staff and consistently received prompt responses. We were able to secure a rate of Euro 110 per night which was extremely reasonable for Venice. Our check-in was quick & the staff was quite accomodating with our luggage. Our room was situated towards the back of the hotel near the entrance to the patio. The recently renovated room was decorated in a rich color palette of blue and gold with a safe, television, phone, alarm clock and comfy double bed. It was a tad on the small side, but you will only spend time in your room to shower & sleep. It looked out onto a courtyard the hotel shared with local residences & we had views of laundry hanging between the buildings. Our only negative experience was the extremely narrow shower. After a day of sightseeing, it wasn't enjoyable to navigate a shower door. Just be careful not to drop your soap! Unfortunately, we didn't utilize the patio since we had such a limited time in Venice (only had a chance to sneak a peak). The hotel itself is located in a wonderful Venetian neighborhood with delicious restaurants nearby. Breakfast is set up in the main lobby of the hotel. Our plans only permitted us to have one breakfast at the hotel, but it was generously stocked with fruits, cereal, cold cuts, juices and, of course, coffee. It was a sufficient way to start the morning. The hotel is a ten minute walk to St. Mark's, but with such wonderful views we strolled our way there enjoying the ambience of the city. The greatest experiences of Venice lie in the backstreets-tour the main sights & then let yourself get lost in the neighborhoods. You won't regret that decision for a moment. We asked the desk clerk for some restaurant recommendations & he quickly responded with some great choices less than a block down from the hotel. One of the most delightful experiences of our time in Venice came at the Ristorante Al Giorgione just down the block from the hotel. We were seated with locals in what seemed to be an extension of the kitchen, eating delicious food (their specialty is seafood), soaking in the atmosphere while being serenaded by a delightful band dressed as gondoliers. At that moment we realized how happy we were with our decision to stay in this ideal neighborhood of Venice. Upon our exit of the restaurant a private party was being held in the front and as we made our way out we were greeted by the owners as well as the guests. It was a comfortable feeling & a wonderful way to spend our last night in Venice. Our second dinner recommendation would be Trattoria Alla Madonna (located near the Rialto Bridge). We had dinner there our first night & were impressed by their perfectly prepared seafood and knowlegable staff. Get there as close to open as possible otherwise you'll be standing in a line that stretches out the door! The weather was ideal for early November-mostly sunny with ideal temperatures (light jacket required). It did rain our last night there & well into the morning. If you travel in the fall or spring, be sure to bring an umbrella. The staff of the hotel were quite helpful with our plans from the beginning through the end of our stay. They were always willing to answer our questions and made sure that our stay was as comfortable as possible. Venice was magical, romantic, elegant and made much more special by our accomodations-stay at the Hotel Ca Formenta and you'll be pleased with your choice!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jenlara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca' Formenta for three nights in mid-October 2005, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great location at a reasonable price. Our room was spacious, clean and bright, and had beautiful views of the Grand Canal and even glimpses of the Piazza San Marco. We could watch the gondolas float by, and one late-afternoon, a massive cruise even ship glided right past our window! The location is great; not too far by vaporretto (or water bus) from the train station, and a short walk to all the best attractions, or to the vaporetto stop when we felt lazy! The staff was wonderfully helpful and sweet, and breakfasts were excellent. All in all, a great place for a reasonable price - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: alout30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my parents and we all absolutely loved it. From the beautiful and enormous breakfast in the morning to the excellent and friendly staff, Hotel Ca'Formenta will make your stay in Venice something special. The rooms are lovely and extremely clean (cleaned daily in fact), with excellent ensuite bathroom, including a shower over a bathtub, and the staff make excellent, affordable restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Ca Formenta is a Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dora Lee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ca Formenta in early October for 3 nights. The hotel was very clean and more importantly, had a laundry service. The employees were always courteous but not always friendly. That didn't really bother us as we found plenty of other people in Venice who more than made up for it. The reason to choose this hotel is because it's not quite as close to the center of town so the area is not as crowded with people. It's still within easy walking distance of the sights (or you can catch the vaporetto to your destination). There are also several very good restaurants down in this area. Each night at dinner we ended up seated next to some great people and had a wonderful time visiting. We found Venice to be absolutely magical. While we were there we attended an opera and spent the evening in St Mark's Square at a Cafe drinking wine and listening to the orchestra. It was one of our more expensive evenings, but we had a fantastic time. Just remember if you sit down to listen to the music, there is a "music charge" when your bill comes. We considered it well worth it as we really enjoyed ourselves. We also took a gondola ride, but didn't really feel it was worth the money. Venice is a great place to stay and the Hotel Ca Formenta is the ideal starting base.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Great Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Stella975
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Ca'Formenta for my Mum and I to stay in whilst visiting Venice as a treat for her 70th birthday. The hotel staff knew it was her birthday and so when we arrived there was a big bottle of bubbly in our lovely, lagoon facing, bedroom. That's not all that impressed, though. The staff were all great, really friendly and helpful (not just those at the front desk). The rooms were bigger than I've been used to in Venice and were ultra clean. The breakfast was good too. Moreover, the hotel is in a great area of Venice - dead close to St Mark's but also right smack bang in a part where real Venetians live. So you can watch the world go by on the patio at the front of the hotel and can chat with the locals when you go to one of the nearby restraunts (we asked the front desk where was good). The Hotel was also offering free trips over to a glass factory in Murano while we were there. I thought the tour would be a bit dull (but thought my Mum would like it!) and was a bit surprised when I actually found it pretty interesting. Not that I could afford to buy anything (you get left to browse in the ultra expensive showroom first and then go down to the cheaper one) but it would be worth it for the for the free trip to the other island in the water taxi, if nothing else. All in all we had a great stay. I'd definately go back to this Hotel and will certainly recommend it to friends...it really was brilliant value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Convenient, Hospitable, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Visitors4
Reviews.Content: These are the words to describe a stay at the Ca Formenta. Wonderful location to go back to after a full day of touring - away from the crowds and by the water. Only 10-15 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco, and a very pleasant walk. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast included is substantial. The rooms are clean. The most comfortable beds we have ever slept on, even in comparison to Western hotels! The cost is absolutely reasonable for the quality of the hotel. One thing to consider, that we haven't seen mentioned in other reviews - the shower stalls in the rooms that our family had, were very small (no baths). We didn't have problems with the size, but if you're a large person, be sure to ask about the showers. The Alilaguna is probably the most convenient and cost reasonable way to get from the airport to town. Take the free shuttle bus from the airport to the Alilaguna dock (less than 10 minutes ride). It's about an hour ride on the ferry to the Arsenale ferry stop. Ca Formenta is only a five minute walk from the stop. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: SHBD
Reviews.Content: I emailed Hotel Ca'Formenta to inquire about their rates as we needed a place to stay from Oct 25 - 28, 2005. They promptly responded back with options and one of them being a "Tourist Apartment" about 150 feet from the hotel. We booked the apartment for 150 Euros a night and were not disappointed. It was just up the street from the hotel next to the 'Trattoria Georgione'. We had wonderful music each night from the owner serenading the patrons and could see the band performing from our window. We had a large bedroom, a nice living room with TV and small kitchen and a newly remodeled bathroom. Although some paint was peeling off the walls, (seems to be a common occurance) it was a great place to stay. We walked to the hotel for Breakfast each morning and their selection was outstanding. There is a supermarket down the street if you wanted to cook your own food. The front desk was very helpful. They gave us a bottle of Prosecco for our honeymoon. We bought a 3 day Vaparetto pass for 22 Euros per person which allowed us to jump on and off all day at all the stops to explore Venice. We took the Alilaguna to the airport for 10 Euros from the Arsenale stop. We lucked out with having ramps over the bridges due to the marathon that was run the week prior so we did not have to drag our luggage over the steps. Be sure to go to the airport early even though we were told 1 hour was sufficient. We went almost 3 hours early and it was still a nightmare. We would highly recommend booking through this hotel and would definitely book with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel from 23-26th October. Location is excellent just a short walk from St. Mark's Square. We booked a superior room sleeping 3 and had wonderful views of the lagoon and towards St. Marks Square. Room was quite spacious, and nicely decorated, with flat-screen TV, mini-bar, also had a table and chairs. Liners sail past on their way into Venice which is quite a spectacle. Quiet hotel, no disturbances, breakfast was rolls, croissants with a sweet filling, hams and cheeses, fruit, cereals etc. Very friendly staff. Venice itself was wonderful, very atmospheric especially St. Marks Square. Go up the Campanile for views, visit the Doges Palace and St. Mark's. Take a gondola ride, we found it cheaper in the morning. Visit the arts quarter behind St. Marks Square and head for Santa Maria dell Saluti. Highly recommended for a short break, I can't wait to return and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Take the Water Taxi”
Reviews.Author: BobMc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good value for money in a very expensive city. Take the water taxi. The hotel has its own jetty which means the water taxi pulls right up to the hotel rear door enabling luggage to be handed straight to the waiting hotel staff. The alternative water bus takes over an hour and involves dragging luggage over foot bridges to reach not only this but any hotel without a jetty. We had a very comfortable room with a lagoon view. The staff we very helpful and the included breakfast very good. The Hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: veggietraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in October. I thought that I had made a mistake by not booking a lagoon view but we were in a room at the rear of the hotel and it was perfect. It was the quietest hotel room we have had in years. Good size and had room for a small table and two chairs where a bottle of Prosecco was waiting for us on arrival - because we were there for a long stay apparently. We had two windows with views of the canal. Lovely bathroom en suite. Breakfast set us up each day for lots of walking and sightseeing. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. We bought Venice Cards online before going and included the Allilaguna trips to and from the airport at half price. The Card was invaluable - gave us access to some museums as well - and we hopped on and off the boat as often as we liked, including trips to Murano and Lido. We were up and down the Grand Canal like yoyos. Other visitors have mentioned the steps on the two bridges between the stop and the hotel and this could be a problem for some people. We are 'older' travellers and managed this although tired after a 3 hour flight delay. During our stay ramps were put up over the two bridges for the Venice Marathon which meant that the walk to the stop for the return journey was easy. The taxi from hotel to airport was quoted at 85 euros which is a lot for two people especially since the Allilaguna fare was already paid. We would also have had the wonderful view behind us. We ate the first night at Giorgione - just up the street - and had a lovely meal but we tried to go somewhere different every time. We had only one meal that we were unhappy with and, unfortunately, I cannot remember the name of the restaurant. All food was Italian but for the lunch at Gam Gam, a Jewish restaurant, in the Ghetto area, which was truly memorable - can be reached by the No. 42. Apparently best to book for the evenings. I am vegetarian and had been given lots of advice on the Tripadvisor Forum which I used. Didn't care for the Coperto or cover charge added in addition to the service charge in lots of restaurants but it varied quite a bit and some made a point of stating that there was no charge and service was included. I would be amazed if anyone had a bad stay in this hotel - people were being turned away during our stay because it was fully booked. I hope to return to Venice some day and will definitely stay at the Ca Formenta. We also went to two concerts which were wonderful - although they each only lasted around an hour. Don't miss the orchestras playing in St Mark's Square after dark - very atmospheric.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ca'Formenta”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Sept. 22-24 (3 nights, 6 people, 3 rooms) and we loved it! After staying in a very small room in Rome we found these rooms to be very spacious. We had a couch in our room and the most beautiful view of the lagoon (room 203). It was wonderful waking up in the morning, watching the boats go by. The hotel is a short walk or ride from Piazza San Marco but it is in a residential section of town (off the beaten track). It was nice to go back to our neighborhood after the crowds in Piazza San Marco. The cafes in the area are open at night in case you want a late night drink before going to bed. There is a money machine and post office right across the street. The people at the front desk were always very helpful. When arriving in Venice (at the train station) with luggage, I would advise taking a water taxi to this hotel because the vaporetto stop (Arsenale) is a short distance from the hotel but you need to go over 2 sets of stairs (not an easy task with luggage). The water taxi takes you right to the hotel back door. It should not cost more than 65 euro (with luggage) from the train station. It was 80 euro for us because we had 6 women and lots of luggage. During your stay you should walk or use the public vaporetto. I would definetly go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Try the Hotel Ca' Formenta”
Reviews.Author: Matteystone
Reviews.Content: Never been to Venice had no idea about accommodation or location. This couldn't have been a better find (thanks Trip Advisor). Five minutes from the Arsenale and a lovely stroll in the evening to St. Martins. Away from the busy tourist areas and in a neighbourhood which was extremely friendly. The hotel, staff and facilities were so welcoming. Go and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: glenellynguy
Reviews.Content: This was truly a 'find' in Venice. We had a lagoon view room that was worth the extra money. We stayed in the 'new wing' and although the room was small, it was beautifully appointed with Murano Glass lighting, marble bathroom, etc... We LOVED being away from the hoards and hoards of people around San Marco. The neighborhood this hotel is in is truly still 'Venetian' so you get a really nice 'feel' when you walk around and go to the shops and restaurants. We also enjoyed having the COOP supermarket down the street to pick up water and snacks. Only negative I can think of was one front desk person, Simone (not sure about the spelling). He had the biggest language barrier of the staff, which wouldn't have been an issue if he didn't have so much attitude. Other than that, everything was great and I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The way to Relax in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before my husband and I left for our trip we were warned that all the hotels were tiny and we would probably be disappointed. Hotel Ca' Formenta was NOT a disappointment!! In fact our room was beautiful and the staff was amazing. We had the only room in the place with a balcony facing the water. The breakfasts are delicious. Plus you get a free excursion to Murano - which is always fun. The one problem that you need to know before chosing this hotel is that its a bit far. It is 7 bridges past St. Mark's Square. Its not such a far walk - but its far from the train station. If you take the Water bus itll take you a bit under an hour to get there - depending on the bus you take. But the hotel is worth it. Tons of good restaurants right down the street. I would go there if you are looking for a good place to get away from the crowd. And before you go to Venice - bring Bug Spray - or be ready to be eaten alive by mesquitos!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Fife_Flyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in July 05 - wish it was longer! This small but charming Hotel lives up to the reviews. We had a lagoon view room on the first floor. Well appointed and big enough. Staff were pleasant, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent and if up early enough you could get one of the two tables outside the hotel overlooking the lagoon. If you are looking for a quiet hideaway then look no further. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Bagpusscymru
Reviews.Content: We spent ten days at this wonderful little hotel. It was really easy to find, just two minutes from the Arsenale waterbus stop, where the Alilaguna ferry dropped us after travelling from the airport, and facing the lagoon. You can catch a Vaporetto (water bus) to anywhere in Venice or to any of the islands from this stop. There are bars, restaurants, a supermarket and local shops, all within a stone's throw of the hotel. It is also close to the local Giardini (like a wooded park) where we took cool quiet walks. San Marco is a leisurely fifteen minutes stroll along the wide pavement bordering the lagoon, yet the hotel is situated in a quiet area, away from the hordes of noisy tourists. The staff were, without exception, helpful and friendly and they all spoke English as well as many other languages. They advised us on good nearby restaurants and booked concert tickets directly for us at no extra charge. Try the â€˜Trattoria Georgioneâ€™ just up the road. The owner serenades you with Venetian songs after youâ€™ve finished eating. Our room was lovely, clean and beautifully decorated (just as in the promotional pictures). We booked one with a view of the lagoon. Seeing the giant cruise ships pass within a few yards of our window was one of the highlights of the trip. The bathroom was a bit small but fully equipped and very clean. By the way, Italian hotels donâ€™t usually provide tea/coffee making facilities, so if you must have a proper cup of tea on demand, take your own equipment â€“ we did and it was nice to be able to have a hot cup of tea whenever we wanted one. The buffet breakfast was very good - a wide choice of food, excellent coffee and very attentive staff who constantly checked everything was OK and replenished the coffee, croissants and cold meats. Yummy. We would highly recommend this hotel. It was well located, comfortable and competitively priced. We will definitely be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Priape
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms were small but very well appointed and very clean. We had a great lagoon view and a really nice touch was the bottle of wine we received on our arrival. It is within walking distance of San Marco and all the sites and there is a vaporetto stop vry near by. We ate at several nice restauarants near the hotel (on Garibaldi) and were very pleased with them. It really was a quiet area but so close to the tourist areas without having the hassle of crowds around all the time, The staff were very friendly and most helpful and the breakfast was very good - more than enough to get your day started on the right foot. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: larsonjo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for exploring Venice on foot. Nice journey from Marco Polo Airport on Water Taxi (a bit expensive at â‚¬80 but worth it). Some good Local restaurants nearby on Via Garibaldi . All in all in an expensive city this is a good offer in terms of room quality,location,service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice and Ca' Formenta Hotel”
Reviews.Author: memisirv
Reviews.Content: Ca' Formenta is everything that Trip Advisor commentators said and even more. They have opened up a new section and we were fortunate to stay in room 407 with a direct water view on the second floor. Check the photos from our room. Room was quite large with an excellent bathroom and very clean. Breakfast was very good. We used the Arsenale vaporetto stop to get around Venice and also to go to the airport. Arsenale is a short distance away with a low and medium height bridge to go over. Giorgio's restaurant down the block on Via Garibaldi became one of our favorites and is reasonably priced plus Giorgio sings and plays guitar most nights. Will definitely return again. One of the highlights of our visit was a Venetin Opera, Ballet and Orchestra in traditional masks. We bought our tickets at Ca' Formenta and seats are not reserved so get there early. We had a 3 day vaporetto pass and it allowed to move from one section of Venice to another veryeasily since the vaporettos move in both directions. We are looking forward to ur return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Charming home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice. We flew in from Rome. Prior to our arrival, we were a bit nervous about the transportation logistics from the airport to our hotel. It turns out, we had nothing to worry about. The stop for public water taxi was very close to the hotel. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly. The rooms were nice, equipped with all the basics one needs when traveling. It is a great value for the rate. The air-conditioning was great, key to the hot Julys in Venice. The service of the staff was superb. They are so friendly! One you step out of the hotel, there is a nice selection of great restaurants and cafes from which to choose (where we ate most of our meals.)
